ampvis2
  • Get Started
  • Reference

Timeseries

This function allows you plot relative abundance reads over time in a timeseries plot.

amp_timeseries(data)

Arguments

data

(required) Data list as loaded with `amp_load()`.
time

(required) The name of the column containing the time variables, e.g. "Date".
group

A variable from the associated sample data to group/split samples by (default: "Samples").
split

Split the plot into subplot of each taxa (default: F).
tax.show

The number of taxa to show or a vector of taxa names (default: 5).
tax.aggregate

The taxonomic level that the data should be aggregated to (default: "OTU")
tax.add

Additional taxonomic levels to display for each entry, e.g. "Phylum" (default: "none").
tax.class

Converts a specific phyla to class level instead, e.g. "p__Proteobacteria" (default: "none) .
tax.empty

Either "remove" OTUs without taxonomic information, add "best" classification or add the "OTU" name (default: "best").
raw

Display raw input instead of converting to percentages (default: F)

Value

A ggplot2 object or a list with the ggplot2 object and associated dataframes.

Contents

  • Value
